subject: Re: [junit] Test Everything, No Matter How Simple
msgSnippet: ... It s my dry British humour. You take a statement about testing everything and ask if that means he s recommending 100% code coverage; everything
messageBody:
On 8/22/06, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> On 8/22/06, Simon Chappell <simonpeterchappell@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > > So you're recommending 100% code coverage?
> >
> > So you're recommending 0% code coverage?
>
>
> Can you explain how you deduce this from my asking for a simple
> clarification about the article?

It's my dry British humour. You take a statement about testing
everything and ask if that means he's recommending 100% code coverage;
"everything" generally means 100%. So, I applied humour by absurdity
and asked if you were recommending 0% coverage, that being the exact
opposite thing.

Simon

--
www.simonpeter.org
